definition: to bow respectfully with clasped hands/to beg humbly
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
body/oneself/personally/to bow
old variant of 躬[gong1]
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
to greet by raising clasped hands

sentences.english: The empress expected everyone to bow and scrape to her.
sentences.chinese: 这位女皇要求人人都要对她打躬作揖。

sentences.english: And the people bowed and prayed to the neon god they made.
sentences.chinese: 人们打躬作揖，向他们所创作的汽灯神灵祈祷。

sentences.english: All his bowing and scraping makes people sick.
sentences.chinese: 他那打躬作揖的样子令人作呕。

definition: to bow with hands held in front
to bow respectfully with clasped hands/to beg humbly
to bend
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to smile apologetically or obsequiously
to apologize
to bow with clasped hands
to offer an apology/to make amends
to bow deeply, starting upright with arms straight out in front, one hand cupped in the other, then moving the hands down to one's knees as one bows, keeping the arms straight (a form of greeting)
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to beg for mercy/to ask for forgiveness
to return a courtesy/return gift
to beg for mercy
to apologize/apology
to be conciliatory or apologetic/to tread warily in dealing with sb
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
